name: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality.
A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale about the future.

name: Pride and Prejudice
description: A romantic novel that charts the emotional development of the protagonist Elizabeth Bennet.

name: The Great Gatsby
description: A story of the mysteriously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his love for the beautiful Daisy Buchanan.

name: Moby-Dick
description: A whaling voyage led by the obsessed Captain Ahab, who seeks revenge on the white whale Moby Dick.

name: War and Peace
description: A historical novel that tells the story of five families during the Napoleonic Wars.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
description: A story about a few days in the life of a 16-year-old boy who has been expelled from school.

name: Crime and Punishment
description: A psychological drama about the mental anguish and moral dilemmas of a poor ex-student.

name: The Odyssey
description: An epic poem about the journey of Odysseus back to his home after the Trojan War.

name: The Divine Comedy
description: An epic poem that describes Dante's travels through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven.

name: Brave New World
description: A dystopian novel about a future world state of genetically modified citizens.

name: The Brothers Karamazov
description: A philosophical novel that enters deeply into questions of God, free will, and morality.

name: Anna Karenina
description: A novel about a tragic love affair and the constraints of society.

name: The Iliad
description: An epic poem set during the Trojan War, focusing on the hero Achilles.

name: One Hundred Years of Solitude
description: A multi-generational story of the Buendía family and their town of Macondo.

name: The Hobbit
description: A fantasy novel about the adventures of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit.

name: The Stranger
description: A philosophical novel about an indifferent man who commits murder.

name: Don Quixote
description: A story of a man who reads too many chivalric romances and decides to become a knight-errant.

name: Madame Bovary
description: A novel about the life of a doctor's wife who has adulterous affairs and lives beyond her means.

name: Ulysses
description: A modernist novel that parallels the structure of Homer's Odyssey.

name: The Lord of the Rings
description: An epic fantasy trilogy about the quest to destroy the One Ring.

name: The Count of Monte Cristo
description: A story of a man who is wrongfully imprisoned and seeks revenge on those who betrayed him.

name: Wuthering Heights
description: A novel about the passionate and destructive love between Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw.

name: Jane Eyre
description: A novel about the life of an orphaned girl who becomes a governess and falls in love with her employer.

name: Great Expectations
description: A novel about the growth and personal development of an orphan named Pip.

name: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
description: A novel about a boy who runs away from home and travels down the Mississippi River.

name: Les Misérables
description: A historical novel that follows the lives and interactions of several characters in early 19th-century France.

name: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland
description: A fantasy novel about a young girl's adventures in a whimsical world.

name: Frankenstein
description: A novel about a scientist who creates a sapient creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment.

name: Dracula
description: A gothic horror novel about Count Dracula's attempt to move from Transylvania to England.

name: The Picture of Dorian Gray
description: A philosophical novel about a young man who sells his soul for eternal youth and beauty.

name: The Call of the Wild
description: A novel about a domesticated dog that returns to the wild.

name: The Grapes of Wrath
description: A novel about the Joads, a poor family from Oklahoma, during the Great Depression.

name: Catch-22
description: A satirical novel about World War II and the absurdities of war.

name: Slaughterhouse-Five
description: A novel about a soldier's experiences during and after World War II.

name: Beloved
description: A novel about a runaway slave and her haunting past.

name: Invisible Man
description: A novel about an African American man's social invisibility.

name: The Sun Also Rises
description: A novel about American expatriates in Europe after World War I.

name: Fahrenheit 451
description: A dystopian novel about a future society where books are banned and 'firemen' burn any that are found.

name: Brave New World
description: A novel set in a futuristic World State of genetically modified citizens.

name: Lolita
description: A controversial novel about a middle-aged man's obsession with a twelve-year-old girl.

name: Of Mice and Men
description: A novel about two displaced migrant ranch workers during the Great Depression.

name: A Tale of Two Cities
description: A novel set in London and Paris before and during the French Revolution.

name: The Alchemist
description: A novel about a young shepherd's journey to the Egyptian pyramids in search of treasure.

name: The Road
description: A post-apocalyptic novel about a father and son's journey across a barren landscape.

name: Life of Pi
description: A novel about a young boy who survives a shipwreck and shares a lifeboat with a Bengal tiger.

name: The Book Thief
description: A novel about a young girl living in Nazi Germany, narrated by Death.

name: Gone Girl
description: A thriller novel about the disappearance of a woman and the media frenzy that follows.
